text: For those who want to know, the solution I came up with was simply to check for the existence of the sprocket menu using JS after the page was fully loaded. Then, if that returns true, I can hide or show specific pieces of content.
loos like you might still need to do it on the front end

Hey there - I have a client using *Mezzanine* CMS as a content management system (files, html pages etc) - however there's no easy way to bulk export the data (and subsequently import into a HubSpot blog.
Their current web agency can provide the db backup and site files. From there, we will have to run a migration/export script on the database using a local instance of Django  - does anyone have experience with this??
